com.mapgroup.client.utility

Class FileSender

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • com.mapgroup.client.utility.FileSender
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener, java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Runnable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class FileSender
extends javax.swing.JDialog
implements java.lang.Runnable, java.beans.PropertyChangeListener
    This class grants to the server to send a file to the client
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      private class  FileSender.Task
      This class starts the real file sending process in a separated thread using the SwingWorker facilities.

      Returns the message associated to the completed operation.

      This method gets called when a bound property is changed.

    • Constructor Detail

      • FileSender

        public FileSender(java.lang.String fileName)
           throws java.lang.Exception
        File sender constructor which initializes the graphical interface of the file sending windows and starts the file sending.
        Parameters:
        fileName - the filename of the file that will be sent
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if some errors occurred in the file sending process

    • Method Detail

      • getResultMessage

        public java.lang.String getResultMessage()
        Returns the message associated to the completed operation.

        The message will be displayed when the process ends in a proper way by the client's graphical interface.

        Returns:
        the message that will be displayed

      • getTransferredFile

        public byte[] getTransferredFile()
        Returns the file content represented as a byte array, a comfortable format with which the file will be sent to the server.
        Returns:
        the file content as a byte array
